title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 35 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 35.

questions.question: On what day did Josiah keep the Passover in Jerusalem?
options: The fourteenth day of the first month
The first day of the second month
The tenth day of the first month
The seventh day of the first month
questions.correctAnswer: The fourteenth day of the first month
questions.explanation: Josiah kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month as stated in 2 Chronicles 35:1.

questions.question: Who did Josiah encourage to serve in the house of the LORD?
questions.explanation: Josiah set the priests in their charges and encouraged them to the service of the house of the LORD according to 2 Chronicles 35:2.

questions.question: Where did Josiah say the holy ark should be placed?
options: On the shoulders of the Levites
questions.explanation: Josiah instructed to put the holy ark in the house which Solomon built, not to be a burden on the Levites, as found in 2 Chronicles 35:3.

questions.question: How many lambs and kids did Josiah give for the Passover offerings?
options: From the flock to the number of thirty thousand
questions.correctAnswer: From the flock to the number of thirty thousand
questions.explanation: Josiah gave lambs and kids from the flock to the number of thirty thousand for the Passover offerings as stated in 2 Chronicles 35:7.

questions.question: Who were the rulers of the house of God that gave cattle for the Passover offerings?
questions.explanation: Hilkiah, Zechariah, and Jehiel, rulers of the house of God, gave cattle for the Passover offerings as recorded in 2 Chronicles 35:8.

questions.question: How many small cattle and oxen did the chief Levites give for the Passover offerings?
options: Five thousand small cattle and five hundred oxen
Two thousand small cattle and three hundred oxen
Ten thousand small cattle and one thousand oxen
One thousand small cattle and one hundred oxen
questions.correctAnswer: Five thousand small cattle and five hundred oxen
questions.explanation: The chief Levites gave five thousand small cattle and five hundred oxen for the Passover offerings according to 2 Chronicles 35:9.

questions.question: Who prepared for themselves and the priests because the priests were busy offering burnt offerings until night?
questions.explanation: The Levites prepared for themselves and for the priests because the priests were busy with burnt offerings until night as stated in 2 Chronicles 35:14.

questions.question: How long did the children of Israel keep the feast of unleavened bread after the Passover?
questions.explanation: The children of Israel kept the feast of unleavened bread for seven days after the Passover as recorded in 2 Chronicles 35:17.

questions.question: According to the text, no Passover was like the one kept by Josiah since which prophet's days?
questions.explanation: The Passover kept by Josiah was unparalleled since the days of Samuel the prophet as mentioned in 2 Chronicles 35:18.

questions.question: Who came up to fight against Carchemish while Josiah was preparing the temple?
questions.explanation: Necho king of Egypt came to fight against Carchemish as Josiah had prepared the temple, according to 2 Chronicles 35:20.

questions.question: True or False: Josiah listened to Necho's message and did not fight him.
questions.explanation: Josiah would not turn his face from Necho and came to fight him despite the warning, as stated in 2 Chronicles 35:22.

questions.question: True or False: Josiah was wounded by archers in the battle.
questions.explanation: Josiah was shot by archers and severely wounded as recorded in 2 Chronicles 35:23.

questions.question: True or False: Jeremiah lamented for Josiah and the lamentations were made an ordinance in Israel.
questions.explanation: Jeremiah lamented for Josiah, and the lamentations were made an ordinance in Israel according to 2 Chronicles 35:25.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Chronicles 35:1: 'Moreover Josiah kept a ______ unto the LORD in Jerusalem.'
questions.explanation: Josiah kept a passover unto the LORD in Jerusalem as stated in 2 Chronicles 35:1.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Chronicles 35:14: 'And afterward they made ready for themselves, and for the priests: because the priests the sons of Aaron were busied in offering of burnt offerings and the ______ until night.'
questions.explanation: The priests were busied in offering burnt offerings and the fat until night as recorded in 2 Chronicles 35:14.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 35 teach us about the importance of obedience to God's commands in worship?
options: Josiah strictly followed the command of Moses in keeping the Passover
Josiah ignored the traditional Passover practices
Josiah changed the Passover date to suit his schedule
Josiah held the Passover without priests or Levites
questions.correctAnswer: Josiah strictly followed the command of Moses in keeping the Passover
questions.explanation: Josiah commanded the people to kill the Passover and sanctify themselves according to the word of the LORD by the hand of Moses (2 Chronicles 35:6), showing his obedience to God's instructions in worship (verses 1, 6, 12).

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with serving in the church. Based on Josiah's example, what biblical truth about service can you share?
options: Josiah encouraged priests and Levites to faithfully serve in their appointed duties
Josiah did not involve priests in the Passover ceremony
Josiah allowed everyone to serve without order
Josiah delegated all service to common people
questions.correctAnswer: Josiah encouraged priests and Levites to faithfully serve in their appointed duties
questions.explanation: Josiah set the priests in their charges and encouraged them to service (2 Chronicles 35:2), with priests and Levites standing in their courses according to the king's command (2 Chronicles 35:10), teaching faithfulness in church service.

questions.question: How does Josiah's preparation for the Passover teach us about stewardship and generosity?
options: Josiah provided lambs, kids, and bullocks from his own substance for the Passover
Josiah only asked the people to bring their own offerings
Josiah neglected to provide offerings for the priests
Josiah borrowed animals for the Passover
questions.correctAnswer: Josiah provided lambs, kids, and bullocks from his own substance for the Passover
questions.explanation: Josiah gave from his own resources to provide for the Passover offerings (2 Chronicles 35:7), demonstrating generosity and stewardship of resources for God's service (verses 7-9).

questions.question: What does 2 Chronicles 35 teach about humility and contentment in leadership?
options: Josiah sought to obey God and follow His law despite warnings from others
Josiah ignored God's commands and followed his own plans
Josiah avoided conflict at all costs
Josiah relied on others to make decisions for him
questions.correctAnswer: Josiah sought to obey God and follow His law despite warnings from others
questions.explanation: Josiah did not heed Necho's warning and chose to fight, showing his commitment to God's ways though it led to his death (2 Chronicles 35:21-22), reflecting humility and dedication to God's will (verses 26-27).

questions.question: A believer feels discouraged after suffering a setback. What encouragement about perseverance can be drawn from Josiah's Passover?
options: Josiah prepared the Passover with great effort and faithful service, showing perseverance in spiritual duties
Josiah gave up after initial difficulties
Josiah ignored the Passover after threats from enemies
questions.correctAnswer: Josiah prepared the Passover with great effort and faithful service, showing perseverance in spiritual duties
questions.explanation: Josiah and the people prepared the Passover fully on one day, with priests and Levites serving diligently (2 Chronicles 35:10-16), demonstrating perseverance in worship despite challenges (verses 1-18).

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 35, how does following biblical worship practices relate to spiritual discipline?
options: Josiah and the people sanctified themselves and followed the prescribed ordinances carefully
Josiah ignored the laws and created new rituals
Josiah allowed casual worship without preparation
Josiah replaced the Passover with another feast
questions.correctAnswer: Josiah and the people sanctified themselves and followed the prescribed ordinances carefully
questions.explanation: The people were instructed to sanctify themselves and prepare according to the word of the LORD (2 Chronicles 35:6), showing spiritual discipline in worship (verses 1-13).

questions.question: What lesson about church fellowship and unity can be learned from the Passover celebration in Josiah's time?
options: All Israel, Judah, the priests, Levites, and inhabitants of Jerusalem participated together in the Passover
Only the priests observed the Passover
The Passover was celebrated in isolation by individuals
Only the king and his princes were involved
questions.correctAnswer: All Israel, Judah, the priests, Levites, and inhabitants of Jerusalem participated together in the Passover
questions.explanation: The text states that all Israel, Judah, priests, Levites, and inhabitants of Jerusalem kept the Passover together (2 Chronicles 35:18), teaching the value of unity and fellowship in worship (verses 17-18).

questions.question: How does the example of the singers and porters during the Passover teach us about faithful service in the church?
options: They remained in their place according to David's commandment and did not depart from their service
They left their duties to join the people eating
They served only when asked by the king
They were not involved in the Passover service
questions.correctAnswer: They remained in their place according to David's commandment and did not depart from their service
questions.explanation: The singers and porters faithfully stayed in their assigned places as commanded by David (2 Chronicles 35:15), illustrating dedication and order in church service (verses 14-16).

questions.question: True or False: Josiah's Passover was the greatest Passover observed in Israel since the days of Samuel the prophet.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:18 states that there was no Passover like the one Josiah kept from the days of Samuel the prophet, highlighting its significance and faithfulness to God’s commands.

questions.question: True or False: Josiah heeded the warning from Necho and did not go to battle against him.
questions.explanation: Josiah did not listen to Necho's message from God and went to fight, which led to his death (2 Chronicles 35:22-23).

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 35 demonstrate the importance of family and community involvement in spiritual disciplines?
options: Families and divisions of Levites stood and served according to their courses during the Passover
Families were not involved in the Passover service
Levites served without regard to family divisions
questions.correctAnswer: Families and divisions of Levites stood and served according to their courses during the Passover
questions.explanation: Josiah instructed the Levites to stand in the holy place according to family divisions (2 Chronicles 35:5), showing orderly community involvement in worship (verses 4-6).

questions.question: Based on Josiah’s example, how should a believer respond to God's call to holiness in daily life?
options: Prepare and sanctify oneself and others to serve God faithfully
Ignore God's calls and live casually
questions.correctAnswer: Prepare and sanctify oneself and others to serve God faithfully
questions.explanation: Josiah commanded sanctification and preparation to keep the Passover according to God's word (2 Chronicles 35:6), teaching personal holiness and responsibility to encourage others (verses 3-6).

questions.question: How does the detailed preparation and execution of the Passover in Josiah's time teach about integrity in service to God?
options: The priests and Levites fulfilled their duties carefully and according to God's law
They hurried and skipped important rites
They performed rituals for show rather than obedience
They neglected parts of the Passover
questions.correctAnswer: The priests and Levites fulfilled their duties carefully and according to God's law
questions.explanation: Priests sprinkled blood, Levites flayed the animals, and offerings were divided as per Moses' law (2 Chronicles 35:11-13), showing integrity and faithful obedience in service (verses 10-16).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Josiah’s Passover was kept in the __________ year of his reign.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:19 states that the Passover was kept in the eighteenth year of Josiah's reign, marking a significant moment in his leadership and devotion.

questions.question: How can Josiah's example teach us about gratitude and remembrance in our spiritual lives?
options: Josiah remembered and celebrated Passover as an ordinance written in the law, with lamentations made for him after his death
Josiah forgot God's laws and did not celebrate Passover
Josiah replaced Passover with new festivals
questions.correctAnswer: Josiah remembered and celebrated Passover as an ordinance written in the law, with lamentations made for him after his death
questions.explanation: Josiah kept the Passover according to the law (2 Chronicles 35:1, 26), and Jeremiah lamented for him with songs made an ordinance in Israel (2 Chronicles 35:25), showing gratitude and remembrance.

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 35.

questions.question: What significant religious event did Josiah keep in Jerusalem according to 2 Chronicles 35?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:1 states that Josiah kept a passover unto the LORD in Jerusalem, highlighting the centrality of this feast in his religious reforms.

questions.question: In preparing for the Passover, Josiah instructed the Levites to place the ark in which location?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:3 emphasizes that the ark should be placed in the house built by Solomon, connecting Josiah’s reforms to the Davidic and Solomonic temple tradition.

questions.question: How many bullocks did Josiah provide from his own substance for the Passover offerings?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:7 records that Josiah gave thirty thousand lambs and kids and three thousand bullocks from his own resources, showing his personal commitment.

questions.question: Which group was responsible for flaying the Passover lambs during Josiah's Passover celebration?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:11 states that the priests sprinkled the blood, but the Levites flayed the lambs, reflecting their specific liturgical duties.

questions.question: What was the role of the singers, sons of Asaph, during the Passover under Josiah?
options: They were in their place according to the commandment of David
questions.correctAnswer: They were in their place according to the commandment of David
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:15 highlights that the singers, descendants of Asaph, performed their service according to ancient Davidic instructions, underscoring liturgical continuity.

questions.question: For how many days did the children of Israel keep the feast of unleavened bread following the Passover in Josiah's time?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:17 explicitly states the feast of unleavened bread was kept for seven days, reflecting the Mosaic ordinance.

questions.question: According to the author of 2 Chronicles, Josiah's Passover was unparalleled since the days of which prophet?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:18 declares that no Passover like Josiah’s had been kept since the days of Samuel, linking Josiah’s reforms to prophetic tradition.

questions.question: In which year of Josiah's reign was this Passover kept?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:19 specifies the Passover was kept in the eighteenth year of Josiah’s reign, providing a precise historical anchor.

questions.question: Which foreign king did Josiah confront after preparing the temple?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:20 records that after temple preparations, Josiah faced Necho king of Egypt, situating Josiah’s reign in the larger geopolitical context of the ancient Near East.

questions.question: What was Necho's stated reason for not wanting to fight Josiah?
options: He was commanded by God to hurry elsewhere
He was unaware of Josiah's presence
questions.correctAnswer: He was commanded by God to hurry elsewhere
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:21 shows Necho claimed divine command to fight elsewhere, illustrating the theme of divine will and obedience in the narrative.

questions.question: How did Josiah respond to Necho’s warning?
options: He disguised himself and went to fight
questions.correctAnswer: He disguised himself and went to fight
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:22 narrates Josiah’s decision to ignore Necho’s warning and approach battle disguised, foreshadowing his fatal wounding.

questions.question: Where was Josiah wounded in battle?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:22 specifies that Josiah fought and was wounded in the valley of Megiddo, a site often associated with decisive battles in biblical history.

questions.question: What was the immediate action Josiah took after being wounded by archers?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:23 records Josiah’s request to be removed because he was sore wounded, indicating his imminent death.

questions.question: Who lamented for Josiah after his death, establishing an ordinance in Israel?
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:25 mentions Jeremiah lamented for Josiah, and these lamentations became an established ordinance, highlighting the prophetic response to Josiah's death.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 35, Josiah’s deeds and goodness are recorded only in the book of the law of the LORD.
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 35:26-27 states Josiah’s deeds are recorded not only in the law of the LORD but also in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah, indicating multiple historical sources.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 35 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What significant religious event did King Josiah reinstitute in Jerusalem according to 2 Chronicles 35?
questions.explanation: Josiah kept a passover unto the LORD in Jerusalem as stated in 2 Chronicles 35:1. This event was significant in Israel's history, emphasizing the covenant relationship with God (Exodus 12:1-30; Leviticus 23:5; Luke 22:15; 1 Corinthians 5:7).

questions.question: How did Josiah organize the priests and Levites for service during the Passover?
options: According to their ancestral houses and courses
questions.correctAnswer: According to their ancestral houses and courses
questions.explanation: Josiah set the priests in their charges and Levites according to their ancestral houses and courses as recorded in 2 Chronicles 35:2-5, which shows orderly worship in accordance with God's law (Numbers 3:5-10; Ezra 3:8; Nehemiah 12:44; 1 Chronicles 23:3-5).

questions.question: What specific instruction did Josiah give to the Levites regarding the holy ark?
options: To place it in Solomon's temple and not carry it on their shoulders
To carry it throughout the city during Passover
To hide it from the people
To offer it as a sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: To place it in Solomon's temple and not carry it on their shoulders
questions.explanation: Josiah instructed the Levites to put the holy ark in the house Solomon built so it would not be a burden upon their shoulders, emphasizing reverence and proper worship (2 Chronicles 35:3). This aligns with the sacred handling of the ark in Exodus 25:14-15, 37:1-9 and Hebrews 9:4.

questions.question: What was the scale of the Passover offering provided by king Josiah for the people?
questions.explanation: Josiah gave a massive offering of 30,000 lambs and kids and 3,000 bullocks from the king's substance as stated in 2 Chronicles 35:7, showing his zeal for proper worship and the significance of atonement sacrifices (Leviticus 1; Exodus 12; Hebrews 9:22).

questions.question: Who among the leaders gave willingly to the priests and Levites for the Passover offerings?
options: Hilkiah, Zechariah, Jehiel, Conaniah, Shemaiah, Nethaneel, Hashabiah, Jeiel, and Jozabad
questions.correctAnswer: Hilkiah, Zechariah, Jehiel, Conaniah, Shemaiah, Nethaneel, Hashabiah, Jeiel, and Jozabad
questions.explanation: These leaders gave generously to support the Passover offerings as recorded in 2 Chronicles 35:8-9, demonstrating the communal responsibility in worship (2 Samuel 8:15; Ezra 7:1-6; Nehemiah 13:29; 1 Chronicles 15:11).

questions.question: How was the Passover lamb prepared according to Josiah's command?
options: Roasted with fire according to the ordinance
questions.correctAnswer: Roasted with fire according to the ordinance
questions.explanation: The Passover lamb was roasted in fire according to the ordinance as in 2 Chronicles 35:13, consistent with the original Passover instructions in Exodus 12:9 and affirmed in Luke 22:15-16 as a type pointing to Christ's sacrifice.

questions.question: Who prepared food for themselves and the priests because the priests were occupied with burnt offerings until night?
questions.explanation: The Levites prepared food for themselves and the priests as the priests were busy offering burnt offerings and the fat until night (2 Chronicles 35:14), reflecting the distinct but cooperative roles in temple worship (Numbers 8:5-22; 1 Chronicles 23:28-32; Hebrews 7:23-27).

questions.question: Which group was stationed at every gate and could not depart from their service during the Passover?
questions.explanation: The porters waited at every gate and did not depart from their service as described in 2 Chronicles 35:15, showing the importance of order and security in worship (1 Chronicles 9:17-27; Nehemiah 12:25; Psalm 84:10).

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 35, how did the Passover kept by Josiah compare to those in earlier times?
options: There was no Passover like it since the days of Samuel the prophet
It was less significant than previous Passovers
It was identical to all other Passovers
It was only celebrated by the priests
questions.correctAnswer: There was no Passover like it since the days of Samuel the prophet
questions.explanation: Verse 18 states that no Passover like Josiah’s had been kept since Samuel’s days, highlighting Josiah’s zeal for covenant renewal and repentance (1 Samuel 7:3-12; Exodus 12; Luke 22:15; Hebrews 9:11-14).

questions.question: In what year of Josiah’s reign was this Passover celebrated?
questions.explanation: The Passover was kept in the eighteenth year of Josiah’s reign (2 Chronicles 35:19), showing the timing of his reforms in relation to his kingship and God's providential plan (2 Kings 22:3; Jeremiah 1:2; Daniel 9:24-27).

questions.question: What warning did Necho king of Egypt give Josiah before their battle?
options: What have I to do with thee, thou king of Judah? I come not against thee this day
Leave your people and join my army
questions.correctAnswer: What have I to do with thee, thou king of Judah? I come not against thee this day
questions.explanation: Necho warned Josiah saying he was not coming against Judah but against another house, urging Josiah not to meddle with God who was with him (2 Chronicles 35:21), illustrating the sovereignty of God in worldly affairs (Isaiah 10:5-7; Daniel 2:20-21; Romans 13:1).

questions.question: How did Josiah respond to Necho’s warning?
options: He disguised himself and went to fight
He immediately heeded the warning and retreated
He sent ambassadors to negotiate peace
He fortified Jerusalem and prepared for siege
questions.correctAnswer: He disguised himself and went to fight
questions.explanation: Despite the warning, Josiah did not turn back but disguised himself and went to battle (2 Chronicles 35:22), demonstrating human responsibility and the tragic consequences of disobedience (1 Samuel 15:22-23; Proverbs 14:12; Hebrews 10:26-31).

questions.question: What happened to Josiah in the battle at Megiddo?
options: He was wounded by archers and later died
He defeated Necho and captured him
He was taken captive but survived
questions.correctAnswer: He was wounded by archers and later died
questions.explanation: Josiah was shot by archers, wounded, taken to Jerusalem, and died as recorded in 2 Chronicles 35:23-24, reflecting the human frailty and the consequences of ignoring divine warnings (Psalm 78:56-62; 2 Kings 23:29-30; Hebrews 9:27).

questions.question: How did the people of Judah and Jerusalem react to the death of Josiah?
questions.explanation: All Judah and Jerusalem mourned for Josiah (2 Chronicles 35:24), showing respect for a godly king and the sorrow for the loss of covenant faithfulness (2 Kings 23:30; Jeremiah 22:10; Ezekiel 19:12-14).

questions.question: Who lamented for Josiah and made ordinances commemorating him?
options: Jeremiah and the singing men and women
questions.correctAnswer: Jeremiah and the singing men and women
questions.explanation: Jeremiah lamented for Josiah, and singing men and women made ordinances in Israel commemorating Josiah’s death (2 Chronicles 35:25), illustrating the prophetic role and liturgical remembrance of godly leaders (Jeremiah 22:10-16; Lamentations 1:1-4; 1 Chronicles 16:4-6).
